In my free time I enjoy working out/bouldering, traveling, and collecting vinyls!

projects.name: Federated Learning AnyLog EdgeLake
abstract: Federated Learning Platform using IBM FL Library and EdgeLake nodes for decentralized machine learning.
tech: Python, Edgelake, IBM FL Library, Ethereum Blockchain, PostgreSQL
description: With the increasing amount of data generated from diverse sources, traditional machine learning approaches face challenges in centralizing data efficiently and securely. This project offers a solution by implementing a Federated Learning (FL) Platform, which utilizes the IBM Federated Learning Library and EdgeLake to train machine learning models without the need to centralize data.

The system ensures data remains local to nodes, minimizing network costs and maintaining privacy while allowing collaborative learning across a distributed network. Blockchain technology is integrated to secure model updates and ensure transparency in the training process.

The platform is fully automated, round-based, and configurable, supporting various datasets and PyTorch models. By decentralizing the training process, this project addresses key issues of data privacy, scalability, and inefficiency inherent in traditional machine learning systems.

projects.name: Key-Value Distributed Store
abstract: Replicated, fault-tolerant, and causally consistent key-value store, with failure detection and recovery mechanisms.
description: This is a replicated, fault-tolerant, and causally consistent key-value store. The aim is to implement a distributed system that ensures high availability and reliability by replicating key-value pairs across multiple replicas.

Key features of this project include Replication for Fault Tolerance, Causal Consistency, Client Interaction, and Failure Detection/Recovery. These capabilities collectively contribute to building a robust and efficient distributed key-value store.

projects.name: MoCode
abstract: App to aid software developers for technical interview
preparation. Uses spaced repetition-based algorithm for optimized learning.
tech: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Python, React.js, Firebase
description: With the increasing demand for effective technical interview preparation, traditional study methods often fail to offer personalized guidance that caters to individual strengths and weaknesses. This project introduces MoCode, a cutting-edge application leveraging an advanced recommendation algorithm to optimize software development learners' preparation for technical interviews.

MoCode tailors its suggestions by analyzing user performance and goals, offering curated LeetCode problems that maximize learning efficiency. This targeted approach empowers aspiring software developers to focus on areas that yield the most improvement, ensuring a streamlined and effective study process.

By personalizing technical interview preparation, MoCode addresses critical challenges of inefficiency, lack of focus, and one-size-fits-all approaches in conventional study methods, making it an indispensable tool for achieving success in competitive interviews.

projects.name: Bug Fest
abstract: Interactive verilog video game that utilizes controls from BASYS3 board with VGA output,
where players control a slug to catch bugs and avoid obstacles.

projects.name: HTTP Server
abstract: Multithreaded HTTP Server that supports multiple clients

projects.name: Info Bot
abstract: Discord Bot that fetches recent news articles based on user input
and has an interactive multi-player Jeopardy game feature.
